0$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/13/2019 11:34:46 AM$Reviewer: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$Recently started taking 2.5mg zyprexa for sleep/depression..lowered lexapro from 20mg/daily to 15..hoping to lower lexapro to 10/mg daily..within a couple days of taking zyprexa I am sleeping better and depression is minimal..hoping it continues working like this

1$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/16/2019 12:14:46 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$1$"I started taking this medication to replace the rexulti I had been taking. Rexulti worked great for my depression but is over $1000 a month
column2: so my doctor prescribed zyprexa. Almost immediately after taking my first dose
column3: I got super drowsy and fell asleep. The entire next day I felt like a zombie
column4: I couldn't concentrate
column5: and I wanted to just sleep all day. I had to leave work early just to go back to sleep
column6: I was that out of it. The second time I took the dose
column7: same thing happened. I'd rather be depressed than feel like I did on zyprexa"

6$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$10/17/2016 9:51:27 PM$Reviewer: Merikay23
column2: 19-24 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$"All of my life I have had anxiety and depression. I also have body dysmorphic disorder. I am 23 years old taking prozac and Buspar. These medicines have helped me. But This medication has changed my life. It is awesome! I wish I have had it all of my life. I usually have racing thoughts/voices in my head every day. They are negative voices that tell me ""you're ugly
column3: you're fat
column4: you're unattractive
column5: nobody wants you
column7: etc."" But this medicine helps more than anything to quiet those negative voices.But if you suffer every day
column8: lIke I do I think this medicine might be good. I used to spend every hour suffering
column9: fighting my thoughts. I couldn't even go into a store. But now don't care as much when I go places. I noticed I am more calm and positive. This medicine makes me want to be more productive and happy. I am on my 2nd-3rd week of taking it. I don't have any side effects so far. This has changed my life and I am so thankful for it. This gives me hope"

column1: 9$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$4/28/2015 3:54:20 PM$Reviewer: So UPset
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver) $2$1$3$"My son was put on this drug at age 32 for depression by a APRN who had never seen him - The APRN had only spoke to my sister

column1: (who was office staff for the APRN) about him.  Very irresponsible.  My son gained over 60 pounds in a few months
column2: his bp sky rocked
column3: and he became diabetic  - just before he died of a fatal arrhythmia- supposedly due to sleep apnea.  This drug made my son unresponsive
column4: lethargic
column5: exacerbated his sleep apnea with weight gain and I believe eventually killed him.  Before my son passed I spoke to the APRN about taking him off of this drug
column6: she just kept saying ""he has to be compliant"".  Where was her compliance with medical ethics? - she had never seen my son as a patient.  Now I read that there is a high probability that this drug causes arrhythmias.    "

column1: 14$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/23/2014 5:03:57 PM$Reviewer: DWL
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $1$1$1$Its been over ten years since I finally got off Zyprexa It was at one of the worst times in my life
column3: with a number of psychological symptoms
column4: including a lack of creativity
column5: muted sense of being able to think in general; I couldn't even think of things to talk about to anyone
column6: especially strangers.  My psychiatrist tried stopping this medication
column7: but when this happened I had a certain mental reaction
column8: with confusion in a part of my brain.  Finally I was able to get off Zyprexa
column10: which at that time was being prescribed in large dosages
column11: which was miserable (I've used Ability in the past few years
column15: eventually I got off that by taking myself off against medical advice.  But the thing I noticed was that once I was off Zyprexa
column16: my creativity improved dramatically and my life became so much more settled and happy.  Over the years I've talked to several medical people (including a psychiatrist)
column17: who said that my premise that Zyprexa caused me brain damage was possible.  I was just going through the extra stress of having dysthymia
column18: a lower grade depression that lasts for years
column20: but eventually my mental condition deteriated to the point that I had a major breakdown psychologically that caused me to eventually lose my job
column21: and ended with about six years of terrible stress.  Maybe this was just a wrong drug for my mental illness
column23: but life has been tough over the years still
column24: but with a brighter outlook.  A number of antidepressants and an antipsychotic definitely helped me stablize

37$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/26/2011 3:26:22 PM$Reviewer: muffin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$1$5$I have taken Zyprexa for 5 years in addition to other antipressants for Major Depression. However I have gained 85 pounds, have horrible sugar cravings, have High cholesterol, high blood pressure, has ruined my usually trim figure. 38$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/13/2011 6:52:58 PM$Reviewer: jjth473, 65-74 Male  (Patient) $1$1$2$Dropped my blood pressure, made me hungry ALL the time, couldn't pee, made me feel like my mind was inside a box filled with cotton. I hated it and stopped it after 5 days. I got better without it using Paxil alone for 8 weeks. Now I take nothing. 
39$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$7/1/2011 10:33:39 PM$Reviewer: Acanthia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$3$2$This is the single most effective medication I have ever taken.  The first dose obliterated obsessions, racing thoughts, and severe insomnia.  The day after was completely different from the day before.  OTOH I had the problems others had mentioned -- sluggishness and food cravings leading to weight gain.  The weight problems are a Catch-22 with me because I gain weight when I am depressed, and while I'm not depressed with Zyprexa, it leads to weight gain.  But I have been able to lose weight while on Zyprexa, and it's only on Zyprexa that I seem to have the will to do it.  That will continue to be a battle.  I've been off it and on it, and would love to find something that works as well without the side effects, but so far no luck.
40$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$6/26/2011 7:07:59 PM$Reviewer: Nancysp, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I first tried it a couple years ago, but stopped due to the weight gain. I did notice a positive change in the way I felt though. I tried other meds since but nothing helped like the Zyprexa did. Now I'm back on it, trying to control the weight gain (15 lbs in 4 mos), better yet my whole life has changed for the better! I sleep better, wake up refreshed and ready to get up and go, go, go! A complete 180 from the 'me' before! It's been a true life-saver for me! I have been on a large variety of meds and was very frustrated! My MD was talking about ECT. I suggested trying the Zyprexa again. I would rather deal with a little weight gain than deal with the memory loss from ECT!! I'm VERY happy I gave it a second chance!! :-)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$"What a truly pleasant surprise. I was given this drug to treat what my PC diagnosed as depression.  Without even realizing it I had slowly but steadily been sliding deeper into depression. I began going to bed very early and sleeping until 11 am
column3: stopped dressing and keeping up with my daily grooming. My family and I were suffering. I began using Zyprexa recently and those close to me that don't even know that I began a new medication have commented how much more ""alive"" I seem. I am in a better mood
column4: laughing more
column5: joking around
column6: sleeping less and dressing up more. Up til now I have not experienced any hyperactivity
column8: and no sedation. Knock on wood. I would recommend this to anyone who has tried other meds with little result. You may just be as surprised as I was."

column1: 66$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$9/13/2009 6:36:00 AM$Reviewer: Jerseyrose2
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$3$2$"Let me just say this. If you are experiencing a major trauma in your life or a major manic episode that you just can't seem to deal with on your own
column3: this is your medication! It works wonders! I've tried quite a number of meds for their tranquil effectiveness and none work like this one.

column1: BE WARNED
column2: HOWEVER! YOUR WEIGHT GAIN WILL BE MASSIVE!!! The feeling is great
column3: but the cravings are uncontrollable! I gained about 10 lbs.in 3 weeks. I recommend it only be used short term. And when I say short term
column4: I mean only stay on it long enough to get over whatever it is you are currently experiencing. As soon as you feel better
column5: you should ask your doctor about switching to another drug.

column1: Zyprexa has redeeming qualities due to its tranquilizing and dulling effect. You will be so ""zoned out"" (for lack of better words)
column2: you won't care about anything. This can work for you or against you; depending on how you look at it. This feeling of euphoria also validates my point about this medication being effective if you are going through a severe traumatic situation and you're prone to having manic episodes.

column1: All in all
column2: I would recommend Zyprexa for short term use only. Discuss other options with your PDOC as you will gain 5 pounds just filling the prescription for this one!"

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$4$I was started on zyprexa after multiple paxil and other medications did not control my depression.  The mood improved very rapidly but the weight gain also kicked in very rapidly also.  I gained fifty pounds in one month with eating healthy and exercising.  The problem was eating all the time.  The sick gut feeling of hunger was too much and I had to come off the medication.  My daughter is now on the medication and we are watching the same response and are demanding the change but needed the immediate mood change to save her life.  The drug is excellent for an immediate response or bridge drug but not a long term treatment medication.

75$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$6/2/2009 3:00:02 PM$Reviewer: dkf
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$2$5$"Zyprexa for me was the best medication for stabilizing my moods.  It immediately calmed me down
column3: helped me get my anxiety under control
column4: and I finally could sleep for more than four hours.

column1: The reason for the high dissatisfaction is first
column2: I was sleepy ALL THE TIME.  I went from four hours sleep to 12 or more hours sleep
column3: and even after all that I was still sleepy.

column1: I had a long commute to work
column2: and there were several incidents where I almost crashed into the interstate divider.

column1: In addition to the sleepiness
column2: I became a food hog.  I ate
column3: ate
column4: ate and ate
column5: and after all that still ate.  I ballooned from 190 lbs to 250 lbs in less than a year.

column1: It is a good drug for bi-polar
column2: and if it were a choice between bi-polar and a better life
column3: and if Zyprexa was all that there was
column4: I would go with it.  Plus
column5: these issue may not be typical for everyone.

column1: I no longer take the drug
column2: and I have not for several years.  I take Lamictal now
column3: and I am back down to 190 lbs.

column1: I hope this review helps."
76$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/26/2009 6:16:32 PM$Reviewer: AkathisiaFreak
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$2$5$"My experience with Zyprexa (olanzapine) is probably not representative of most patients who take the drug.  I have learned (the hard way) that I am very sensitive to anti-dopamine drugs such as Zyprexa
column3: so what I say here won't apply to everybody.

column1: In any event
column2: I got the drug to combat major depression as well as frequent mood swings that felt like the hypomania of Bipolar-II disorder.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: my treatment ended up a disaster (your experience will vary).  I had hypoglycemia occasionally as a kid
column3: and this medication (taken when I was 21) brought it back.

column1: The worst side effect
column2: though
column3: was ""akathisia"" (an incredibly horrific sense of anxiety; time seems to slow to a stop and you can't stop yourself from pacing around the place).  Akathisia isn't too common with this drug (as compared to even other newer antipsychotics
column4: such as Abilify/aripiprazole)
column5: but it hit me hard with Zyprexa personally.

column1: Overall
column2: I would not recommend this drug to anybody who has had a bad reaction to other sedating antipsychotics (such as Seroquel/quetiapine)
column3: whether the negative reaction was blood sugar issues or akathisia.

column1: However
column2: Zyprexa's mild sedation (not as bad as Seroquel's or that of the older antipsychotics) will help a lot of people who are willing to put up with the blood sugar issues.

column1: But for me? It was a total disaster.

77$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/22/2009 1:48:22 PM$Reviewer: AllisonJune, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $3$2$5$The longer I was on Zyprexa, and the higher the dosage, the more weight I gained and the more I slept. I gained 50 pounds in 5 and a half years before I was finally taken off of it. I've been completely off of it for less than 2 weeks, and I've already lost at least 10 pounds. I didn't mind sleeping all the time. I kinda liked it, but I knew that 12 to 18 hours a night wasn't normal. Zyprexa kinda deadened my emotions, but I didn't mind. The numbness was better than the pain. It really did help me, but I couldn't keep gaining weight. I am 5 foot 3 inches and weighed 160 pounds, compared to 110 or less when I started. It really put stress on my body.
78$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/21/2009 3:39:55 PM$Reviewer: John, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I take a small dose only as needed and only for as long as I need it (2.5mg to 5mg).  I go through episodes where I get non-stop anxiety so bad that I can't sleep at all
column2: one big adrenaline rush.  This is the only medication I've used that's helped.  I've been struggling for 13 years with this and after a half hour of taking the first dose I was able to lay back on the couch and just breath and relax.  When I'd fall asleep is was really deep (which
column3: made me groggy in the morning it was so deep... but that was far better than the alternative).  I've read a lot of bad reviews on weight gain
column4: so I made sure not to over-eat even if hungry on it (I didn't have any large hunger changes).  However
column5: I also only took it for 7 days at the most.  Now
column6: when I feel an episode come on
column7: I take it for 1-2 nights and it's succesfully stopped me from having that episode go farther.

column1: I'm still nervous to use it because of what I've read
column2: but my experience with it has been good with how I am using it (low dose
column3: short periods).  "

column1: 88$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$11/6/2008 12:58:19 AM$Reviewer: BW
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$1$5$I also take Lexapro for depression
column3: which has worked great in the past. But during this trial
column4: I was still depressed and ABSOLUTELY could not sleep. I dabbled with many sleep aids but many actually stimulated me or the side effects were too much
column5: or would make me more depressed. I began by taking this to sleep and help with the depression. I took 5mg. I fell right to sleep and awoke 10 hours later. I woke up feeling quite refreshed. I was not tired the next day
column6: and HAD NO DEPRESSION AND ANXIETY
column7: which had effected every part of my life for months prior. It worked excellent with Lexapro for my mood
column8: thought process and motivation. I felt amazing
column11: I would not stop eating. I have always been able to keep plenty of food and snacks in the house
column12: without temptation to over eat. However
column13: this day was much different. I could not stop eating. I LITERALLY COULD NOT STOP EATING. No matter how full I was
column14: I still COULD NOT STOP EATING. I swore every snack/meal was my last
column17: still full. Yet I did not feel nausious like I always have in the past when I had over eaten. I could just eat
column18: and eat and eat. At the end of the day
column20: I tallied some of the things I had eatin
column21: and realized I had well exceeded 5000 calories! Amazing
column22: from a person that comfortably eats 2000-3000 calories a day. The next evening i took 2.5mg. But the day after was no different than the one before. I stopped taking it and it took 3-4 days for the habitual eating to start to go away. I took 5mg a week later
column23: with the same gloriously amazing effects on my mood. But it had the same horrific effect on my eating consumption
column24: which took another 3-4 days to begin wearing off. Being overweight is one of the most depressing
column25: uncomfortable and unhealthy things in the world
column26: so why would anyone take this for ANY REASON. DO NOT TAKE THIS. Its comparable to heroin feels great but isnt worth TheSideEffects.
